name: Visio Custom User Interface File
summary: Learn about .VSU files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: The VSU file type was introduced with the release of Microsoft Visio 2000. When a user modifies a custom UI, the VSU file is not updated until the program is closed.
In Windows XP, VSU files are saved in the following directory:
In Windows Vista, VSU files are saved in the following directory:

description: A VSU file contains information about a custom user interface (UI) for Microsoft Visio, a program used to make drawings and technical illustrations. It stores information about various UI elements, such as menus, toolbars and status bars. VSU files are often used to save custom user interfaces created by users.
